localizedDescriptions.sl: Generic encounter or progress note composition

annotations.comment: Tags applied to the composition. They can contain various ids, such as episode id, central case id or other types of information forming composition meta-data.

localizedDescriptions.sl: *A measurement of the body temperature, which is a surrogate for the whole body temperature of the person.(en)
*The measured body temperature (as a surrogate for the whole body)(en)
*The thermal situation of the person who is having the temperature taken(en)
*The person is covered by a lesser amount of clothing or bedding than deemed appropriate for the environmental circumstances(en)
*The person is covered by an amount of clothing or bedding deemed appropriate for the environmental circumstances(en)
*The person is covered by an increased amount of clothing or bedding than deemed appropriate for the environmental circumstances(en)
*Description of the conditions applied to the subject that might influence their measured body temperature.(en)
*The anatomical site of measurement of the temperature(en)
*Temperature is measured from within the external auditory canal(en)
*Temperature is measured from the skin of the axilla with the arm positioned down by the side(en)
*Temperature is measured in the urinary bladder(en)
*Temperature is measured within the vascular system(en)
*Temperature is measured in the inguinal skin crease between the leg and abdominal wall(en)

*The local measurement of arterial blood pressure which is a surrogate for arterial. pressure in the systemic circulation.  Most commonly, use of the term 'blood pressure' refers to measurement of brachial artery pressure in the upper arm.(en)
*Peak systemic arterial blood pressure  - measured in systolic or contraction phase of the heart cycle.(en)
*Minimum systemic arterial blood pressure - measured in the diastolic or relaxation phase of the heart cycle.(en)
*The average arterial pressure that occurs over the entire course of the heart contraction and relaxation cycle.(en)
*The difference between the systolic and diastolic pressure.(en)
*The position of the subject at the time of measurement.(en)
*Standing at the time of blood pressure measurement.(en)
*Sitting (for example on bed or chair) at the time of blood pressure measurement.(en)
*Reclining at the time of blood pressure measurement.(en)
*Lying flat at the time of blood pressure measurement.(en)
*Lying flat with some lateral tilt, usually angled towards the left side.   Commonly required in the last trimester of pregnancy to relieve aortocaval compression.(en)
*Sleep status - supports interpretation of 24 hour ambulatory blood pressure records. (en)
*Subject is in the natural state of bodily rest.(en)
*The craniocaudal tilt of the surface on which the person is lying at the time of measurement.(en)
*The size of the cuff used for blood pressure measurement.  (en)

annotations.comment: Perloff D, Grim C, Flack J, Frohlich ED, Hill M, McDonald M, Morgenstern BZ. Human blood pressure determination by sphygmomanometry. Circulation 1993;88;2460-2470.

localizedDescriptions.sl: *A cuff used for an adult thigh - bladder approx 20cm x 42cm.(en)
*A cuff for adults with larger arms - bladder approx 16cm x 38cm.(en)
*A cuff that is standard for an adult - bladder approx 13cm x 30cm.(en)
*A cuff used for a small adult - bladder approx 10cm x 24cm.(en)
*A cuff that is appropriate for a child or adult with a thin arm - bladder approx 8cm x 21cm.(en)
*A cuff used for infants - bladder approx 5cm x 15cm.(en)
*A cuff used for a neonate, assuming cuff is the appropriate size for maturity and birthweight of the neonate.(en)

*Body location where blood pressure is measured.  Use 'Location of measurement' to select from common sites.  Use 'Specific location' to record more specific details or a site that is not in the common set or to refer to an external terminology.(en)
*Common body sites where blood pressure is recorded.(en)
*A finger of the subject.  Identification of the finger can be recorded in 'Specific Location' data element, if required.(en)
*A toe of the subject.   Identification of the toe can be recorded in 'Specific Location' data element, if required.(en)
*Invasive measurement via transducer access line within an artery. Location of the transducer can be recorded in 'Specific Location' data element, if required.(en)
*Method of measuring blood pressure externally, using a stethoscope and Korotkoff sounds.(en)
*Method of measuring blood pressure externally, using palpation (usually of the brachial or radial arteries).(en)
*Method of measuring blood pressure externally, using a blood pressure machine.(en)
*Method of measuring blood pressure internally ie involving penetration of the skin and measuring inside blood vessels.(en)
*Record which Korotkoff sound is used for determining diastolic pressure using auscultative method.(en)
*The fourth Korotkoff sound is identified as an abrupt muffling of sounds.(en)
*The fifth Korotkoff sound is identified by absence of sounds as the cuff pressure drops below the diastolic blood pressure.(en)
Uporablja se za zapisovanje podatkov o napravi, ki se lahko uporablja neposredno v terapevtske ali diagnostične namene; ali neposredno v zagotavljanju zdravstvene oskrbe.
*Any timed recording of Body Mass Index.(en)
Višina/dolžina pacienta, izmerjena od vrha glave do podplatov na nogah
*Any timed measurement of height or body length.(en)
Višina/dolžina pacienta, izmerjena od vrha glave do podplatov na nogah
Pozicija pacienta, ko se izvaja meritev
*The mechanical heart rate  - usually measured by palpation(en)
*The rate of the heart in beats per minute.(en)
*Comment about the heart rate and rhythm.(en)
*The position of the patient when the heartbeat was recorded.(en)
*Person reclining at 45 degrees with legs raised.(en)
*Source of heart rate and rhythm record.(en)
*Derived from the electrical activity of the heart, commonly via an electrocardiograph.(en)
*Details about the method or machine used to record the heart rate and rhythm.(en)
*The body site where the pulse was measured(en)
*The apex beat of the heart (left 5th intercostal space, mid-clavicular line)(en)
Metoda merjenja prisotnosti plnov kot so Spo2 in TCO2 na indirekten, posreden n-invazivni način
Saturacija kisika v krvi izmerjena s pulzno oksimetrijo.

annotations.comment: SpO2 is defined as the ratio of oxyhaemoglobin (HbO2) to the total concentration of haemoglobin (HbO2 + deoxyhaemoglobin).

localizedDescriptions.sl: SaO2 je izmerjen na prstih leve roke
SaO2 je izmerjen na prstih desne roke
SaO2 je izmerjen na prstih leve noge
SaO2 je izmerjen na prstih desne noge
SaO2 je izmerjen na dlani leve roke
SaO2 je izmerjen na dlani desne roke
SaO2 je izmerjen na levi nogi
SaO2 je izmerjen na desni nogi
SaO2 je izmerjen na levem uhlju
SaO2 je izmerjen na desnem uhlju
*A text comment about the indirect oximetry result.(en)
